The food was all good, but the hummus stole the show. It was so delicious and flavorful. The service was awesome. Very attentive. The atmosphere was nice too...clean, interesting things to look at.

Sabas Mediterranean is a great little restaurant for date night or family night. The staff is always friendly and can answer any question you might have. 

They also have a great $5 gyro happy hour! Which is an awesome deal because the gyros are very tasteful.  I also really like the falafel.

This is my favorite Mediterranean resturant.  George and Liz run the family resturant with authentic family rescipes.  I have a couple of favorite dishes, Shawarma Chicken, Falafel (best ones in town) and Lemon Shrimp Pita  are my top 3 picks!

Customer service was good
Food on the other hand was not what I was expecting for Arabic food
If your looking for authentic food this is NOT the place

Went on a whim, we had smelled the food one evening but if was Good Friday... no meat. Went back..... Delish!!! Eggplant side dish is amazing, hummus was fantastic.... you must love garlic! Perfection. The meet was cooked to perfection juicy and tender. Dishes are big, you can share if you like. My son loves the Greek fries, the combo plates are perfect sampler of everything! The rice melts in your mouth. Kiddos to the chef, we watched her from our tabel. Dinner was busy, she made cooking look easy.

Perfection!!!! I'm a transplant from Pittsburgh, PA and was missing my favorite mom/pop Greek restaurant. Stumbled across Sabos and fell in love. I convinced my fiancé to try Mediterranean food and now he loves it too. Hands down the best scratch restaurant in the valley. The food is fresh well prepared and the prices are excellent. I have too many favorites to list. Just go eat there and You Will be hooked. Oh and try the date/nut bar for dessert. It's bomb!!!
Best Gyros I have found in AZ!  Always fast and friendly service! Love eating here!

Great Mediterranean food, super friendly service.  Chicago gyro is the best I've had in Phoenix, or Arizona for that matter.  Felt like back home at the Greek restaurants in Chicago.  Best all around waitress I've encountered in years.  I'll be back for sure!

Stopped in for lunch on a weekday. Service is nothing special, but the food is pretty good. 

The $5 Gyro special was a good value, mint iced tea was refreshing, and the lemon rice soup was AWESOME. I don't know how I had never had this soup before, but I am very excited to grab lunch there again sometime soon.

This place has some of the best Mediterranean cuisine in Arizona, period.  I had passed by this place several times on my way to Rubio's over the past 5-6 months and never gave it a second look.  After hearing someone mention it as a yummy place to get hummus and a gyro I decided to meet up with my family for dinner.  I am still thinking about the amazing meal I ate.
We showed up a bit early from what I had anticipated so the fiance and I decided to start with a couple of appetizers.  Flaming Cheese and Greek Fries.  The cheese was AMAZING and the fries were addictive.  Awesome spices and feta cheese.  Since we were waiting for the rest of the family to show up we struck up a conversation with George who told us a little bit about himself and the food.  He also brought a couple of samples of their soup.  Split lentil and lemon chicken rice.  Both were so flavorful and yummy!
Finally the family arrived and we ordered dinner, chipotle gyro and the Spanikopeta (sp?) with the lemon rice chicken soup poured over.  Absolutely delicious.  Ate everything despite already being so full.
Finally, we finished it off with Turkish Coffee and baklava, both pistachio and walnut.  Left feeling so very full and I cannot wait to return.  If you're in the area I cannot recommend this place enough.  You will have a wonderful experience.
This place is awesome! It's a family run business where the food is always fresh, and the service is always on point. If you are looking for a casual Mediterranean place, this is the spot.

From appetizers to dessert, everything was absolutely delicious!! I had the Chicago Gyro and my husband had the lamb shank, both prepared to perfection. Our waiter, Jared, provided excellent service and great suggestions. Leave room for the spiced date paradise crumble!!

We don't come here often, but when we want to splurge on fries with feta cheese, ranch and buffalo sauce... this is the place to go!
And we were in the mood for exactly that today.

Hubby had the regular gyro, I had the chipotle gyro. They both were good. Service was fast.

Note:
** We asked for extra tzatziki and we were charged 49 cents for it. It was a little too much dill for my taste but it was OK.
** We were coming from the movies, so we had had our huge drinks... I had an Entertainment Book coupon but it was pretty much useless, because it is for only 50% off a second entree, and you have to order 2 drinks... so it not much of a deal, you probably are better off skipping the coupon and the sodas (healthier and cheaper)
** However... we asked for water and... it tastes terrible. I think it has happened before. For the last year or so I am trying to drink more plain water and less sugary drinks/artificial sweeteners, so this is not the place for that : (

We also thought the gyros seemed smaller this time.

Last time I think I ordered a gyro salad and it was good and huge. I also remember baba ganoush has been very good here.

We decided to do something different and have a Gyro party instead of my typical taco party last weekend with 10 people total. I paid less ordering form Saba's than I would have if I made the taco meal myself! It was delicious!! We even had leftovers the next day. I ordered the gyro meat for 10 with hummus, yogurt dip and pitas! I made a salad with all of the fixing's and it worked out perfect. First time customer and I will definitely be back!
Good place near the house to grab a salad or Greek food. Good prices and quick in and out.

It was "ok", not too Mediterranean , wasn't impressed with their food as much as their menu, ordered the gyro and my husband had the shawarma, definitely not even a comparison to the original/authentic  gyro and shawarma flavor texture that we are used to. Only reason we stopped by was because it was the closest and we were short on time . Their fries were good though. There's only 1 waitress that was handling all the tables, while she was great, but I don't think it's right to have 1 waitress serve about 10 tables during lunch hour... With the help of the cashier boy every now and then .

Best! I love gyros and try them all over town,  and Saba's are the best. I have tried a few of the other menu items  (soup, hummus,  baklava) and they're all good here.  The family that runs the restaurant is nice,  and for what you get,  the prices are better than reasonable. LoL, it's across the street from my parents' home,  and my ex would always offer to take me to visit,  not because he was a nice guy, but  just so we could hit Saba's on the way back to Mesa. It's casual enough for t's and jeans,  but cozy and classy enough for a budget friendly date night.... Go here, you won't be sorry. You're going to be impressed.

This place is great!! Amazing food and service... I highly recommend  the lamb shank !! The servers are polite and will get you anything you need to make the experience of eating there great. My girlfriend and I love this place and will be back often .
The food looked and tasted perfect! We loved the service too. Ambiance is cute and warm. I ate it so fast I forgot to take a picture haha

Chicken on the green salad is sooooooo good! I have to be honest, I have yet to try something else since this salad is so freaking good! I am never disappointed with this item. They give plenty of chicken for this salad. I most definitely will be going to the restaurant to try other items. Love this place!!

Carlos is THE BOMB! 
He recommended the best food!
SUPURB service!
Delicious food!
Carlos is THE BOMB

This place has some of the best felafel I've ever tasted. That being said, tonight I ordered Tabouleh along with hummus and gyro meat. 10/10. Solid quality. No wonder they've been in business for 21 years! You can't be in business that long if you're not being consistent. I love the fact that's it's a family business and not some huge fast food chain trying to make nothing but profit by lowering the quality over price. Would definitely return and highly recommend.
Their bruschetta is by far my favorite of any place I've ever tried it at. Their lemon rice soup is just as good, and the atmosphere is so cozy and cute, at least at this location.

Yum. In the North Phoenix area, there are about two Middle Eastern restaurants, one of which is Pita Jungle, but I've never been a fan. I drive by Saba's all the time and finally had the opportunity to stop by. I was pleasantly surprised.

The lemon-rice soup was divine, and they offer a truly vegetarian option as well. There are also numerous vegetarian choices on the menu. We started with saganaki, which was passable, and my main dish was a pita with tabouleh, hummus, feta, and pepperoncini. I'd never thought of putting that in a pita, but it was a great choice!

Service was quick other than that I had to ask for a water refill. The prices were fantastic. I will definitely be heading back to try all of the other veggie choices, and this will be my first choice in Mediterranean fare in my neighborhood.

My husband and I have been coming here for over 15 year.  We used to love this place, but it seems the quality has gone down considerably and prices have gone up.  Tonight my husband had the gyros sandwich and I had the Sleepy Salad.  They gyros meat was inedible, it tasted so processed that we ended up discarding of the sandwich and salad.

I don't know what happened to this place!  We will not be coming back.

They need to go back to the quality they once had.  The gyros meat used to taste fresh.  

So disappointing.

I come here often for lunch . Very quick and tasty . Consistent and great value. I bring out of town guests here and they always enjoy. Great menu for those who like ethnic food and many options for those who don't .

3 stars... I really wanted to give more stars, but the food was just ok and the strip mall location doesn't add anything to the experience either.  

I went to dinner here the other night with my boyfriend on HIS SUGGESTION.  Since I had never been before, I was up for the new adventure.  I like that it is just a casual little place and the pictures of Greece on the walls had me thinking it may impress me.  Unfortunately, not the case.

I will say that our waitress, Anna, was really sweet and knowledgeable.  You could tell she's been working there for years.  We started with the red lentil soup which was delicious and Anna brought us a taste of the spinach curry soup as well - it was spicy but tasty and had me excited for what was to come.

We went with the Sleepy Gyro Salad and the 'Vegetarian Plate II" which was more than enough food for us to share.  Too bad none of it was that great.  The vegetarian plate came with hummus, baba, falafel, dolmas, tabbouleh, spanikopita and yogurt sauce for $12.45.  Not such a deal.  The hummus is better at Pita Jungle, the baba ghannouj was ok but really smokey, the falafel just eh, the dolmas and tabbouleh both mediocre, and the spanikopita was dry instead of moist and flaky...

The 'sleepy gyro' salad is filled with too many onions and has a ridiculous amount of garlic... If you like onions, garlic, and gyro though, this is a good deal at $8.55!

Sorry, Saba's - even though Anna was a great waitress, I will not be coming back to visit you anytime soon... instead, I'll be on the hunt for Greek / Middle Eastern Cuisine that compares to that I grew up with in Detroit!

Great little Mediterranean Restaurant. All the meals are delicious and filling, They have a full menu of gyros, and other Greek specialties. It's a small place but the meals are worth the wait if necessary,

I was looking through Yelp and noticed Saba's site. My husband and I have eaten here on many, many occasions and have never ever been disappointed with any of our meals here. The servers are always cordial and service-oriented. Saba's gets our vote for a go to Mediterranean restaurant! Making me hungry for a falafel sandwich just writing this review! Yum ;) Try it for yourself, I know you will not be disappointed! Their menu has something on it for everyone, whether you are vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free or non-committed, you will find something on it to order. You will be glad you did!

This is such an amazing gem! My husband and I have been going here for close to 10 years. It's family owned and operated and the care and attention to detail is definitely there! I can't say one bad thing about anything on the menu. We've tried nearly everything and it's all delicious!

Being from Chicago, I am very familiar with and fond of great Greek/Mediterranean restaurants. There are a multiplicity of them in Greek town and there is Cedars Mediterranean Kitchen in Hyde Park. I am also very familiar with a variety of neighborhood, fast-food gyros joints.

Now in Phoenix, I decided to visit Saba's. My opinion of it depends on the basis of comparison. Compared to the fast-food gyros joints, it's one of the best. Compared to real Greek restaurants it's one of the worst.

I had the Lamb Shewerma. The pita, sauce, lettuce and tomatoes per fresh ad tasty. However, the lamb, which should have been the star of the show, was under-seasoned. The fries were crisp, hot and delicious. (But this I can get at many fast-food joints.) Of everything I ate, I enjoyed the pistachio baklava the most.

I LOVE this family owned restaurant. I have been coming here for 13 years and this restaurant only gets better as the years go by. A lovely atmosphere with great food and amazing service. A definite MUST when visiting this area.
I love this place! Best hummus, best falafel and best soups! Great staff, too.

They are so good! Mediterranean home cooking at its finest. We love this place! I discovered Sabas back in 2007. Just recently started ordering from them again. They are a bit of a drive from us. So, the hummus is flavorful. Some places it's just bland. Not here. Very Tasty. My husband is a big fan of the gyros. I always end up getting a bite or two, or three...or... I digress... I am a big fan of their kuefta kebab platter. The baba ghannouj and tabbouleh are amazing. Check them out if your in the mood for some amazing Mediterranean home cooking!

Urban Spoon App pick. Decided to try for lunch after Alice in Wonderland. We of course tried the "infamous" flaming cheese and it did not disappoint, in presentation or in taste. Their pitas are fantastic..not thin and dry like the grocery stores. They were fluffy and doughy as they should be. Followed it up with the Gyro and it was plenty filling on its own without any sides added. I noticed below that someone was complaining about the amount received in the sides and from the picture, that side was one serving. We wonder why we're so fat in America.. it's because pretty much everywhere you go, you are given 2 to 3 servings presented as a single serving and we eat it as if it's one. I applaud and appreciate them for actually giving 1 serving because either you're overeating and will be fork lifted off your couch one day or you'll eat the one serving and throw the rest of it way and waste it. Plus the sides are less than $2 , order another one??If you're pinching your pennies that tightly you should probably be staying home and eating ramen.

Came here for lunch and had the sleepy gyro salad and the Jerusalem salad with chicken shawarma. 

Both salads came with pita bread and tziki sauce. 

The Jerusalem salad was very tasty and filling. 
The gyro salad was just okay. It needed some sort of dressing (we got some Greek)....but even with the dressing it wasn't the greatest meal I've ever had. 

I think the salads were a bit overpriced.....we paid 25 dollars for the 2 salads (not including tip) and no drinks. 

If I was in the area I might stop back for the Jerusalem salad but I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
Outstanding Middle East food!! Service is great and the three entree special is authentic and wonderful!

Sabas has been around forever,  and the quality has always been consistently good.  Their $5 gyro pita deal is insane for the great gyro you get.  The tzazilki (I know I spelled that wrong) is delicious.  

Try the lamb too, its veey good. The owners and staff are always very nice.  Good local spot.

We really, really wanted to like this more and PLEASE someone correct me if I'm wrong. The food just tasted a little off. 

My partner and I have eaten a lot of Greek food, we love it. When we lived in Chicago, Greektown was one of our favorite places to have dinner. So, why does the food at Saba's taste so...different?

The Avgolemeno Soup was good as was the service. We just weren't jumping for joy over the food. I had the Chicken Sultani and my partner had the Chicken Gyros Platter. Both were just okay and it really came down to the seasonings they used. They just seemed to be too pungent or aromatic.

We might try Saba's again, but for something more mainstream like Gyros.

So I'm a pretty big fan of Mediterranean food and have tried quite a few places throughout the Valley.

The food here was maybe slightly above average in comparison to the other places.  We ordered the chicken shawarma, lamb Kuefta, Tabbouleh salad, hummus and lentil soup.  Everything was really good with the exception of the Kuefta which was pretty dry and unimpressive.  The meal includes 1 small piece of pita bread, which isn't enough, nor was it very good. They charge extra for an additional piece. They only include 1 small container of sauce, Tzatsiki or Tahini, and they charge extra for an additional container.  Not a big fan of their nickel and diming.

Overall the food and service was good, but there are much better values out there.
Great great lunch stop. The chicken shawarma was just amazing with a cup of red lentil soup.

Food was pretty good. 
Service sub par. (At least today at 1pm it was...). I felt like I deserved a tip at the end.

During the many times I came in to either ask for something, get the bill and drop it back off, there was no obvious manager around, or I definately would have said something.

Great Arabic food! I lived in Dubai my entire life before moving to the USA and was looking for an authentic Arabic restaurant. Saba's Mediterranean Kitchen hits home run with its flavours! Very authentic food. Mine was a to-go order that I placed via phone. It was ready in 15mins, as promised. We ordered the traditional hummus, tzatziki, falafel, fries and bread.

Also, I got a 10% discount for checking in on Yelp! Portion sizes are good. 

I'll be going back soon for a dine-in experience. :)

I tried around two dozen other places around the valley for Mediterranean food and not one of them came close to being as fantastic as Saba's. 

A valley-local owned and operated spot for many years, the current owner George has personally greeted me on many occasions, and that is the not the least reason why I always come back. Fantastic bottled beer from several unique locations, amazing hummus combos for appetizers, and a gyro which truly deserves the name "World Famous."

Others have commented on how good the entrees are and I don't disagree. Everything is prepared carefully and served simply, this place is easy on the wallet and easy on the pants size due to healthy fresh ingredients.

For starters, you cannot miss the Flaming Saganaki. With a traditional flair for showmanship, you'll hear either George the owner or one of his fantastic servers shout "OPA!" before setting fire to your appetizer. Dinner and a show!

As mentioned, I have tried many other places searching for the "Perfect" gyro. While I don't truly believe that something can be 100% perfect, the World Famous from Saba's comes close. Piled up with fresh beef and lamb, filled with delicious veggies and just the right amount of tzatziki sauce, the real secret to this sandwich lies in the marinated gyro meat, which is cooked and shaved normally, but then cooked again in a special marinade sauce which makes this Gyro one of the juiciest and most satisfying you will ever have.

Dessert is not to be missed either, simple items make a big impact here, with my personal fave being the ice cream and pita. They specially treat the pita for dessert with honey, powdered sugar, and upon request chocolate or raspberry sauce. With a dollop of delicious vanilla in the middle, you will be very satisfied by the simple pleasure. The baklava deserves an honorary mention as well.

Everything on the menu is great, but more importantly, this restaurant provides an amazing family-dining feel that seems like you're stepping into George's living room. Getting to know the owners is part of the charm of this small but excellent spot. 

Final Verdict: If you have an option to choose between winning a million dollars or eating at Saba's, take the million dollars and then spend all of it on Gyros at Saba's afterwards.
Cute family business! The humus is amazing! Great service! I filled up on humus so had to get my lunch to go! Looking forward to my gyro for dinner!

This is a nice, locally owned place with some pretty delish food.  The meat is exceedingly tasty and veggies fresh and crisp.  Sauces are pretty bold and garlic forward.  My hubby and I share the three meat meal and it's more than enough for both of us and the two kids.  One minus, our takeout order came with only one pita.  I called and let them know that I thought it was odd.  Apparently you're supposed to order additional pita.  This seems a bit chintzy to me.  At the very least, let the to-go orders know.  I'm happy to pay for more but once you're home, it's not like you'll go back out.  

Overall, the food is tasty and healthy - grilled meats, veggies & salad.
Love this place!  The food is fantastic and the servers are more than friendly and accommodating

Ick.

It was one of those evenings when you toss dinner options back and forth, but nothing really sticks.  

In retrospect, we should have stayed home.  Even in the barren, food-less space that is my kitchen, I could have done better.  However, lured by an ad boasting a "World Famous Gyro" for the bargain price of $5, off we went.

Upon arrival, we were quickly greeted by a man I assume is the owner, shown to a table, and given menus.  A few minutes later, he came back to tell us he would send someone over to take our order.  Great.  Strangely, the waitress that arrived to ask us what we would like to drink couldn't/wouldn't take our food order, as someone else was actually our waiter.  Huh?  Well, we finally were able to order from our real waiter (who was very nice, by the way and the ONLY reason for 2 stars vs 1) and our World Famous Gyros arrived shortly.  

Uh, no.  What I found on my plate was a pile of sauce wrapped in paper.  The entire gyro was drowning in tzatziki.  Now I happen to really like tzatziki, but but not to the point that I cannot even identify what I am supposed to be eating.  I scraped off as much as I could, but then only tasted overly salty meat, soggy lettuce and yes, sauce.  After a few bites, I waved the white flag of surrender - I just couldn't do it.

Guess you get what you pay for....

Great food! I've been looking for a good place to get Mediterranean food for quite some time and they have definitely delivered. You can tell the gyro is fresh and it has a smokey taste to it. The Greek fries are also delicious. Also, everyone I have come in contact with has been very nice and my food always come out quickly .

So, just happened upon this place, the server, after I've already had a double cocktail, asks if I'm driving... Call me weird, but I thought that was the most responsible thing ever. Oh, the food is damn good too. Cozy, and the outside is deceiving.
The Sleepy Gyro Salad was very good and quite filling. I went with the large.
Been coming here for at least 15 years. Never disappoints! Service is always family friendly, food is always on point, and restaurant is clean.  They are able to modify to any dietary restrictions.

I've been eating at Saba's for about 10 years and it is always a delight! They have a ton of choices, the food is incredibly flavorful, and the prices are very fair. This place is really a hidden gem - tucked in the corner of the strip mall on the corner, it doesn't seem like it would be a great dine in location, but it is! They recently redecorated (or maybe it was within the last year), but they have really created a beautiful atmosphere. The service was kind and attentive. 

I went with my parents, and both ordered salads. The "regular" is plenty large. My dad opted for the "large" and found himself with way more than he could eat (which is saying a lot for my dad!). I made my own two-item platter with falafel & baba ganoush. The falafel were very galick-y, which I love, and I got about 9 falafel! It was a ton of food, and I ended up eating it for days. We also got a hummus appetizer, and that was a great way to start the meal.

I'm glad this place is doing well, it really is a neighborhood joint. It seems like the owner & staff knew most of the customers coming in, whether for dine-in or pick-up. Give this place a try, and you will fall in love! Also, they have a check-in offer of 10% off!

We've eaten at Saba's for years now, and the food was always good. Last night we got our dinner to go, and it was pretty bad. We had the calamari appetizer, which has always been wonderful. Last night, it was undercooked, it was practically raw, and it smelled fishy. If we had been dining in, I would have returned it. I had my usual Falafal sandwhich, and it also wasn't very good. The Greek fries were soggy and limp, not crisp.  I don't know what was wrong, if it was just an off night, of if they are going downhill. I have no desire to go back, and it was one of our favorite restaurants. I give them 2 1/2 stars, because they used to be 4 stars in my book.

Delicious, when was the last time you ate all homemade food at a restaurant!? 

We'll get ready for it here. The best gyro meat I've ever tasted. Normally it's hardly warm and tasteless, not at sabas, it's charbroiled to give a slight bark and the flavor is so so good. Homemades sauces and great service.

Meh. 
Its good. I have been here before...its just not the best. 

I had a bad craving for a falafel sandwich, only pita jungle is a bit more of a drive from my work. So I called up Saba's and placed a pick up order. 

When I got there, I was promptly ignored and not greeted even though there were 2 people behind the cash register. The old man grunted at me and pointed at the order I just watched him bag up (I had placed an order for 4 people, nothing crazy by any measure) I asked if I could give him half cash and the rest on my card...I get another grunt (more of a disapproving grunt), this clearly put him in a bad mood. I said thank you I don't know how many times, but that wasn't enough. 

When i got back to work I was a bit disappointed. I ordered a side salad with my falafel and the house dressing was some really weird dressing I have never had, though the lettuce was very fresh and crisp...My falafel its self was ok. The patties were good, the pita bread got super soggy really fast and I was sad to see no onions or cucumber or hummus in it like pita jungle does. 

If my co workers wanted to go here again, I would most likely order something else and give it another try, but wouldn't suggest it if it was up to me.

Is six stars an option. We love this family owned business. They go out of their way to make every experience a good one. The staff cares and has fun too. The portions are huge and the prices fair. The quality of the food serves is as good as you can find. (Take them up on the offer to grill your gyro meat). I heard the owner handle a complaint over the phone and he couldn't be apologetic enough. When the customer came in he was treated like a best friend and everyone was happy. Can't get enough of this mom and pop establishment

I like Sabas for a number of reasons. It's family owned (be sure to check out the family photos on the wall); they're local (not many choices other than fast food nearby) and the hummus is actually on the tasty side (unusual on Phoenix). 

The service is hit or miss depending on the day and time. It has limited seating inside and often the only table available is the one where the restroom might as well pull up a chair its so close. Pricing is reasonable and the specials are good without fail.  

Worth a visit but only to get take out.

Dropped in for lunch and what a little hidden gem ! Menu outside got our YES to come in .. So many delicious sounding choices was hard to choose from ! Open the door and what cute decor , I was expecting like a taco shop feel or sandwich shop but it's a cute little restaurant hole in the wall place :)  (which I love). We got the fresca pita and world famous with spicy feta fries , so good you just can't stop eating no matter how full you are ! Flavor is good , all the meat is fresh , chicken in mine was all white meat :) no fatty gross pieces . We will def be back !

I have been going to Saba's for over 10 years now and always had a good experience. Up until today I would rate it 4 stars. Yummy falafel, delicious vegetarian red lentil soup were among my favorites. Their house dressing is lemony goodness. 

But today's visit pushed them to a 5 star for me.

While running errands, I stopped in for a quick bite. I intended to keep it light and healthy. Which is very easy to do here. Salads, vegetarian pitas, soups are all healthy choices they have that are also very delicious. 

They have added some exciting additions to their menu since I have last been in.

I see the rolled hummus sandwich which I have had before and enjoyed. Pita, hummus (which now you can choose from different kinds- I chose pesto hummus), lettuce, tomato, cucumber, and a pickle. Yum. And I knew I wasn't completely blowing my diet.

Then I see Greek fries and my heart stops. Feta, herbs and spices, and lemon wedges on fries?? Would I like to add them on to my wrap? Um, yes please.

I was kicking myself for doubling my calorie intake while I was waiting for my food. 

The food comes out fast and all my guilt and self-loathing are replaced by pure desire for the food I'm about to consume. The portions were ginormous. Big enough for 2. I make a deal with myself to only eat half the fries. The fries covered with the most feta and spices of course. The pita was crunchy, hummus-y yummyness. The fries were so damn tasty. 

The prices, especially the sandwiches and salads, are very reasonably priced. I checked out the drink menu and noticed bottled beers were between $3 and $3.50. Not bad at all. They had a couple unique beers by the bottle and by tap. 

Service was warm, friendly, and prompt. 

Afterwards, I thought "Why I have been away for so long?" But I will be back Sabas. Oh yes, I will be back.
Yesssss!!!!!!! Finally a good Greek restaurant!! And they have saganaki! Their spicy feta fries are killer and the gyro meat is so tender. We will be coming back for sure!

Delish!
Lots of yummy food!
We have lived in the area over 2 years and never stopped in. What a shame! 
Now we know better. 
Great food. Friendly workers.
Service can be iffy, but the traditional gyro is my favorite! Their fries are GREAT! This is another one of my go-to joints. Love the food, the ambiance and the close location. Keep up the good work!

We love eating here and order takeout almost every other week. My favorite place in Arizona for babaganosh. The flavors are great and the service is always fantastic. The shwarma is very authentic and good as a sandwich or alone as part of a plate.
Had the Lamb Shawarma Pita - generous helping of very tender lamb in pita. Very tasty.

This isn't much of a place for the "expierience" but the cheap eats and decent food paired with fast and efficient servers makes this an easy 5 stars. 

They have a few items you can make vegan, the Gyro lunch special is great. You can get just the Gyro for $5 or make it a combo for $6.50. For that you get a nice pita wrapped around some of the better falafel in the valley with lettuce, tomato and tahini and a good portion of a side of fries or other side of your choice.  It's not the best I have ever had but compared to other Falafel offerings in Phoenix, which are downright horrible at times, it's pretty good. 

The service is always friendly but not overly bearing and the servers are usually always the same people at lunch and they are always on top of things and now whats up. The food comes out fast so it's great for a quick lunch spot while still getting sit down service.

LOVE Saba's, it's one of our favorite restaurants. It's a small hole in the wall greek place, seems family run, great menu and really affordable. The gyros and platters are SO good and the hummus is the best I've ever had. The staff is fabulous, always friendly, fast service! This place is good for lunch or dinner.

This is one of my favorite neighborhood eateries. My family and I have been eating here off and on for 15 years.  Mom and pop establishment that serves excellent Greek/Mediterranean food. Mint flavored ice tea is awesome. Great gyros, humus, salads, and dinner combos. Not a bad pick on the menu. The quality of the food and service will keep you coming back for more.

What a great little secret!  From the front I had no idea there was even anyone in the place. Then I opened the door and it was packed with diners, Middle Eastern music playing sort of low. Diners all chatting.  And the smells!  Omg!  So I ordered a safe cheeseburger for the finicky grandson and some hummus and grape leaves and a gyro to split with the granddaughter. And we ate outside. They both loved the food. Even the grandson took seconds on the hummus. Oddly enough the opportunity arose 3 days later for a house warming party and we bought food for 15. Except there was enough for 30.  Try the lamb shanks. The food is the best M.E. Food I have ever had and I'm a Greek. Several of us agreed the baklava was by far the best we gave ever had.  Sooooo good.  Thanks George.

We loved our Greek salad,  the dressing was very zesty.    I had the chicken pita which was typical of a standard gyro. Now my guest had the lamb gyro which she said was moist and tasted amazing compared to any other she ever had. 

The staff was very nice and took time to educate us on the menu. It would be nice if there were pictures because everything sounds yummy!

At about 615pm the place became packed and people were waiting to be seated.

Overall a good experience and we will be back.

 he best dressing I have had.  Our gyros one lamb and one chicken were moist and flavorful.  Highly recommend!

Thank you, Yelpers, for helping us find this fabulousness!
We were at the MIM and developed a taste for Greek (somewhere around the Greek section of the museum), did a search on Yelp and decided the reviews were great AND this was soooo close. So why not?
It was all sorts of yumminess. Started with the Greek Fries... good start. I had Chicken Shawarma and the hubs had a Shawarma (and I didn't pay attention, was chatting and eating). My vegetarian sister had a Starter combination with 5 different appetizers, all equally yummy.
We were not let down! All was good. My sister and I had leftovers enough for lunch the next day.

Comfortable, clean, friendly staff. Good prices, fabulous food.

We HIGHLY recommend!

This is just a wonderful Mediterranean restaurant. We have tried many of the dishes and continue to be amazed at the outstanding flavor of all the dishes we experienced. Definitely a must try, gyros "Chicago style",Greek fries, lemon rice soup, it's all delicious!

This place was not what I expected, but it definitely has some flavorful bite-worthy menu items. Giving it some flare from and setting it apart from your typical Greek spot. 

 *** Must Try ***



* Steak Pita: Tender angus beef it's ridiculously good and melts like butter 

* Grandmas Meat Dolmas: Stuffed with rice, pine nuts, and fresh herbs 

* Red Lentil Soup: Not just your typical Greek lentil soup, they add a little kick making a delicious subtle spicy tomato herb  soup 

Bon Appetite

My little sister works just down the street and discovered this through work friends. She asked that our family bring her here for her birthday dinner. 

This is a great little place. The food is amazing and the service is great. We had an assortment of the hummus, baba ganoush, grape leaves, falafel and tabbouleh. All amazing. We then all got different meals, i got their gyro just to try what they claim was the best, and it was. Everything was fresh and authentic and delicious and the waiter was so patient with my insane little family! 

I will definitely be going there again.
I've been back to this restaurant since my last review. They have been taken over by the kids.  Things are running smoothly, service is great, and food is healthy and tasty.

This place was good. We got the flaming cheese skillet, it was so fun to see but also was very good. I thought the price was pretty standard for a greek restaurant. The fries could have used a little of that orange seasoning I usually see at other places, the yellow rice was good, tzatziki sauce was good, lamb kebab was flavored well, gyro meat was good but a little too smokey, chicken shawarma looked like chicken breast but was fine. I think I would repeat everything I ordered again, with the exception of the chicken shawarma - was just a little boring compared to everything else.

I would definitely come back.

I have been here quite a few times, and I have never been more impressed.

The gyros are great! The Chicago style is my favorite but this time I tried the Philly Gyro. I think I have a new favorite. 

We were waited on by the owner (George). He was very attentive and answered all of our questions. The prices are super as well. If you have not been here then I would recommend you stop by for lunch as soon as possible.

The only downside is that it is located in a very small space. It doesn't make that big of a difference unless it is busy.

Keep doing things right, George!
This place is great for lunch!  Might be for dinner also, but I have only been there for lunch.  The Chipotle Chicken Gyro is awesome!

I always love coming here because I can always trust the food to be nothing short of AMAZING. The staff is incredibly friendly, fast, and really knows the menu like the back of their hand!

I can never go wrong starting with George's Caprese along with a cup of their lemon rice soup. Just the 2 items alone will satiate me and my appetite, but for those days where I just have a mighty need to devour my weight in food I'll add their world famous gyro and a side of the spicy feta fries, which is something I'd never heard of before coming here. Fries covered in Buffalo sauce and Feta cheese... it sounds strange but DAMN is it freaking delicious!!

They have a little bit of everything for everyone, so you can't go wrong coming here!
Low key spot where you can be super casual or take a date. Sabas has REALLY good mediterranean food. Quick and friendly services and food is ALWAYS fresh! Good variety of Greek beer!
My husband and I love this place!! Great family owned atmosphere and even better food!!! :)

We've found our new favorite Mediterranean restaurant.  Had the chicken shawarma, with the pesto hummus and Greek fries. Yum! The chicken was cooked perfectly and the flavor was amazing. The best Greek fries I've ever had.  Still crispy despite all the toppings. I've never had pesto hummus, but I'm a fan now. Can't wait to return and try other things on the menu!  Next time the Spicy Greek Fries. Another patron had the Flaming Baklava while we dinned, needless to say after that performance, we'll be trying that next time.  And I don't want to forget to mention, everyone was super friendly. It was a pleasure!

One of my favorite dive restaurants in Scottsdale. 

It's hard to find lamb anywhere, let alone good lamb. 

The lamb at Sabas's is good (not great).

But it's the atmosphere, great waiters, like Jared, that make this a five star place that you'll return to often.

I just ate here for the first time. Ordered carry out. I got the spicy feta fries which were the best thing ive ever eaten in my life and I got the ckicken kabobs which were also very very good. It was really busy but I would definitely come here again and again and again. My new favorite place!!!

My wife and I have been eating here for a few years now...Mainly just for lunch.  Stopped by today to grab a gyro sandwich to go...it was good, can't beat the lunch special price!  

We usually just have the lamb or traditional gyros, vegetarian plates, or an entree salad..have tried their entrees and they are just OK..so I stick to the tried and true....if I am hankering for a gyro I think of Saba's

I love this place! I love Mediterranean food and used to go to pita jungle all the time... until I found this little gem. Don't get me wrong pita jungle is great but this place has better prices and authentic delicious food. It's family owned so the service is always great and friendly. We frequently walk in and order take out because it's healthy and fast. The chicken salad is delicious and the gyro meet is awesome too. The hummus and pita is also very good and they give warm pitas if you take out or eat in. They have a good assortment of alcohol too! Highly recommend this place.
I crave this place and drive from Peoria to eat here every chance I get. Baba Ghannouj is outstanding. I have been coming here for over 10 years.
Delicious!!!! Came here for lunch today and I had the Greek salad and a cup of lentil soup. Fresh and healthy and yummy! Price is good for the freshness and quality. Fast service too!

Small space, was slammed on a Friday afternoon, but didn't wait very long for a table.  Had the chicken shwarma, spicy pesto fries, and hummus.  Attentive service, ample portion size, all quite delicious...loved the pesto fries.  Definitely got to try again.

My kids and I stopped at Saba's in between soccer games and we all loved this place! The staff was very nice, and the food was delicious. The pita was fresh, the hummus was amazing, and I'm so glad the server recommended the saganaki. My kids thought the flaming cheese was pretty cool to see! Can't wait to go back!
Great food nice people here. The gyros are the best I've had in the area by far. We come here every time we are in the area.

I love this place!! Their "World Famous" gyro is best. It's really the only thing I ever order. DH's usual dish is the Chicken on the Greens salad which is like a super-charged (generously portioned) Greek salad with delicious chicken. Greek fries are loaded with goodies and quite tasty (if you eat-in, doesn't travel well). I don't love the hummus here but for me, it doesn't even matter. Get the "World Famous" gyro!!

Sabas has been my "go-to" Mediterranean place for going on 20 years now. Family owned. Awesome people. Awesome food.. Literally can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Most of the time I need to restrain myself from ordering too many things! Because it's literally all great! Hummus, Saganaki (probably not spelling that correctly) Soups,Authentic Pita Sammiches of all kinds, and The Lamb Shank...Omg The Lamb Shank :)
Absolutely amazing from the time we came in till we left.  Food, service was absolutely excellent.  The service that George gave was a good as we have ever had.  Thank you all at Saba's!

Shocked. That's what I was because from the outside, this place is plain but once inside, it is anything but.

Although there is a distinct Greek theme here, the place gave off a more middle Eastern vibe (much more so than Greece based on my recent trip to Greece this summer).

I love gyros but wasn't hungry enough for one in a pita, so I ordered a regular size Greek salad with gyro meat, aptly named Sleepy Gyro Salad. So tasty and so much food! 

Our waitress glided to our table. She was also busy, when she wasn't caring for customers, she was sweeping or vacuuming. 

Definitely a place I'll return to if I find myself this far north in the future.

We hadn't been here for quite a while...and now, I wonder why? We had a very good meal with attentive, friendly service in a casual and authentic environment on a busy weeknight.

We loved the dolmades- tightly wrapped, flavorful filling- not mushy.  The lamb schwarma was tender, tasty and delicious! I love their basmati rice and also had my entree with tabbouleh which was yummy in my fresh pita with the lamb! The falafel gyro was also very good.
AMAZZZING! My favorite restaurant in all the Phoenix metro area!! The Gyro is to die for and the Greek salad is out of this world delicious! The meat is super high quality and cooked to perfection!

This was my first time at Saba's and I went based on all the positive reviews. I was extremely excited because who doesn't love a local joint with good food?!? I even easily convinced a friend to accompany me. 

Sadly, we were not impressed. Contrary to all the reviews, I found our waitress unfriendly. Only at the time we were paying our bill, did she smile and ask if I wanted a drink for the road. How about using that same attitude at the start of service and not at the end?!? 

The food. We started by getting the hummus. The pita bread was cold and hard. The hummus was okay. Having lived in Dearborn, Michigan for many years, I've had much better hummus and pita in my lifetime, so Saba's fell short by a long haul! 

I got the Chicago style Gyro. The meat was a little crunchy, as described, but it was over salted and not very flavorful. And so so dry-- a little more tzatziki sauce would have been nice. My friend got the Chicken Pita and her's was just as dry as mine. 

Overall, it was a "meh" type of experience and sadly I don't think I'll be going back...
Great place to eat if you are a vegetarian or vegan. The service is great an fast and very nice and helpful servers.

Seriously delicious. I always get the Chicago gyro and fries. The Chicago gyro has the meat slightly grilled and is so full of flavor. I don't know what they put in the sauce but it is by far the best sauce I have ever had. Even their fries are good!!!  

Saba's is always busy every time I'm there. Dining in or getting a Togo order it doesn't matter!  My kids ask to come here all the time. Needless to say this is a family favorite of ours. But Saba's isn't only a favorite of mine but a favorite to many in this area as you will notice by how busy they always are. The staff is so friendly and they get to know you which makes coming here even better. The manager is super helpful when ordering and having questions about the menu. One time the cooks put the green garnish on my daughters rice. The manager knew that rice was for a child and quickly had them replace it with no garnish. He is very attentive and genuinely cares about the food and his customers which is nice to see. 

If you want super good Mediterranean food this is the place to go. You will not regret it. However you may find yourself frequenting this establishment more then others!
Best Greek restaurant in the neighborhood! Great service, and amazing food. Plus it's locally owned!

Seriously the most flavorful amazing and delicious gyros I've had in a long, long time. Hummus was extra garlicy... Just how I like it! It is pricey for the amount that you get... But the meat alone is totally worth it. Gotta get it Chicago style.

Ambiance is really nice. You can tell they hold on to their roots and take pride in being family owned. They have beautiful photos of the Christian quarters in Old Jerusalem that I very much enjoyed as a fellow Palestinian. Loved their "break the chain, eat local" slogan. Service was great. The food...

I had a Fattoush salad with chicken shawarma. It was excellent but nothing like a traditional Fattoush salad and I wouldn't consider their chicken as traditional shawarma. They had a good amount of veggies in their salad and the vinaigrette was excellent. I was in a hurry and only ordered a salad because I'm eating healthy but I'll definitely be back to try more food!

Terrible. I have no idea what these reviews are talking about. Ordered the chicken shawarma, humus, and roast vegetables. 

I kid you not, the shawarma was NOT traditional shawarma, but simply a few pieces of seasoned chicken breast that can be made at home. The pita that accompanied was stale, and not the kind of firmness that you get from grilling it. The staleness seemed like it arose from leaving the pita bread outside. The humus was awful.  As for the vegetables they were terrible - way overcooked and the eggplant was most likely spoiled. I ordered this meal on a Monday at about 5 pm, but that is no excuse to do a poor job. Worse yet, you can get a meal that is 10 times better at Haji Baba in Tempe for less. 

If you are looking to waste your money on terrible food, then that is the only reason to be at Saba's Mediterranean Kitchen.

Had such a great experience here that I started drafting this review waiting for our bill. What an amazing Greek/Mediterranean experience. The service was remarkable. This place was packed and we were still given top quality service. The food is amazing! This is the only Greek spot in the entire valley who still serves their saganaki authentically: lighting it on fire right at the table - OPA! This place was so amazing we struck up conversation with two separate tables about what we ordered and if we had tried other items on the menu, as well as how remarkable we thought their service was. One couple mentioned they were from Prescott and after finding this place on Yelp, make a point to stop here on every trip because they love it so much. Highly recommend trying this place! And if you get the gyros sandwich, get it "Chicago style."
Best food in this town if you like Mediterranean that is. Run don't walk and get over here it is scrumptdillyious!  Sleepy Gyro Salad is my favorite!

So thankful a friend introduced me to this restaurant. I have been there twice and I can't wait to go again. so far I have had the falafel pita with hummus and the gyro plate and both were so good; especially the gyro. Falafel had great texture and flavor. Again, I can't wait to go again and it won't be soon enough. My only complaint (and I'm surprised I would have an issue since I like onions) were I thought the onions on the pita were cut too thick and were a little strong. If they just cut the onions thinner, would be perfect.

I love Sabas!  Their food is fresh and delicious and the people remember who I am, what I like and what my food allergies are.  I love the chicken shwarma and the lamb shwarma either the plate or in a wrap.  They substitute their yogurt dressing for one that I can eat.  I love their salad dressing for the salads.  The humus is really good.  I sometimes get the humus with cucumber instead of pita.  I get the kind of pita that doesn't have milk or eggs in it.  It's not a fancy place but it's warm and inviting and has great food.  Been coming here for years.  Enjoy!
Great authentic Mediterranean food. I got the chicken schwarma, steamed veggies and hummus. Big portions so I had enough left over for dinner too.

It's been a year since we visited this part of town.  Had to go and hit this place up as it was great the last time we tried it.  They knocked it out of the park again.  Service is impeccable.  The young lady who seats us, serves us, and cleans up brings tons of energy to the place.  The food, well let's just say we haven't and won't attempt any other Greek food but this place.

I went to Saba's feeling a little scared.  Fast food Greek in a strip mall?  This could go one of two ways...surprisingly good or health code violation bad.  

I am very glad to say it didn't end being the latter.  In fact, the food here was pretty damn good.  I did expect Saba's to be an order at the counter joint, so I was a little disappointed to see it was actually a tiny restaurant.  I like my Greek fast and cheap, okay?  But I got over it, got a table and began the interminable wait for our server to stop chatting with other diners and take our order.

The menu has all the normal Greek items, including falafel- little fried balls of joy I might add- gyros, vegetarian platters, spanakopita and dolmas.  Prices for the sandwiches and gyros are pretty cheap, but when you venture into the platter territory, you're going to pay for it. Platters start around $10 and go up.  I ordered the falafel, of course, and so did my boyfriend.  The pita sandwiches don't come with any sides, so we ordered a basket of fries to go along with our meal.

The dcor was pretty cool with big pictures of Greece all over the walls and the classic Greek music piped in.  Unfortunately, not even the Greek music could mask the hideous, loud tool of a diner that was sitting at the table in front of me. He was one of those idiots that has to talk so loud, even the half-deaf cook in the kitchen can hear him.  He was so loud I felt like I should respond to his questions.  Hey moron- saying things like "I like it loose, like my women," is just not funny.

Anyways, when we finally got our food, it was really good.  The falafel pita and the fries were tasty, but our server sucked.  He obviously knew the loud tool, and kept chatting with him while we waited for our check.  That was a little annoying, but overall, Saba's is a good choice for a quick Greek meal.

Saba's has never disappointed me in the 15 years that I've been coming here! First off, it's family owned and ran. Everyone is super friendly and hospitable. The food is superb! Definitely get the saganaki to start! My go to dish here is always the Greek salad with chicken. Their side of pitas with their tazitki sauce that accompanies it is the perfect meal!

This is NOT authentic Mediterranean. For starters all of their Arabic dishes were absolutely awful. We ordered Shawarma and got grilled chicken style pieces
Completely covered in garlic aioli. More shocking was the beef Shawarma my husband ordered.. they served shredded beef!  

Hummus was awful, grainy, watery and flavorless, presentation was awful and not appetizing, very overpriced and place is dingy. 

Very confused by the good reviews. Disappointing Phoenix!

Great discovery! Small local family owned, say Hi to George when you go. It's a bit of a hole in the wall, but the food is fantastic, authentic and very fairly priced. Service is great. We will be eating here as often as possible. Highly recommend! Oh, try the Greek Salad with chicken.

I have been eating here for years, and the food is great. My Israeli friend says it's the best he has found in Phoenix area. My Armenian friend also was taken aback when I brought him here. He had taken me to a place in Scottsdale that was the best middle eastern place he knew in town, and was pleasantly surprised with Saba's as his new favorite. I did give it 5 stars when mom and dad did the cooking, but it's still the best I've found.
This is my family's go to restaurant. Alway good. Great serve and very friendly. Get your gyro meat crispy and you'll be in heaven. Also, try the feta fries as a appetizer.

Very delicious geek food.
I had the lemon pepper shrimp pita sandwhich. Hummus was very good too. Fresh pita bread to top it off.

First time trying Saba's and I wasn't that impressed. I got the 2 entree option with chicken and steak kabob. As for the sides, I got humus and the yellow rice. When the food came out, the rice was hard and cold, the chicken was over cooked and dry. The steak was also very chewy and not fresh, didn't have a lot of flavors. Hummus was heavy on the garlic ingredients, and the pita bread was hard and cold. Just so disappointed in the overall quality and quantity of the food. Quite pricey for the amount of food. 1 star for the new outdoor porch which was nice to sit at and 1 star for the customer service. I would perhaps give them another try in the future.

This is our go to place for Mediterranean food.  They have great hummus and baba  ganoush.  I love the build your own appetizer plate.  We have been going here for almost 10 years now and wont stop anytime soon.

This is a very cute little neighborhood Mediterranean restaurant. Tonight we tried and enjoyed the hummus, baba, and gyros. Super casual atmosphere, but great flavor and great service will bring us back to Saba's again.

Saba's is one of our favorite local places since the service, food and menu prices never disappoint!  
Our family of four is routinely sat within minutes and the service is always prompt, polite and welcoming. 
We have recently tried to incorporate more vegetables in out diet so we have frequented Saba's more often and continue to enjoy this great establishment which has the best falafel pita, hands down!

Outstanding Mediterranean food. Flaming cheese appitizer is a excellent starter. The lamb is normally served medium and I ordered it medium rare. It was cooked perfectly. The pita bread come two ways. As a fluffy light pita and the second a pita pocket which is thinner. Both are excellent and delightful to eat with your dinner. Gyro meat is very tasty. If you like it sliced from a large block as we do you love this place. Steak kabob also super tender and well seasoned.

Great menu, great service , 10% discount when you check in. My husband ordered dolmas, falafel, and chicken schwarma with baba ganoush and somehow managed to finish it all! My daughter and I had lamb shanks that fell off the bone in a wonderful sauce. My other daughter had a lamb pasta dish that was also outstanding! We'll be back!
Amazing food... Good service... Have visited so many times.. Never got disappointed.. chicken shawarma is a must... You won't forget it's taste... Mediterranean food lovers must visit..

Amazing mediterranean food! This place is as authentic as it gets, and the family there makes sure to delivery quality eats and a super clean/cozy little hole in the wall. Literally my only complaint was that the a/c was set to arctic storm (haha), but other than that this place is amazing. STAY FOR THE BAKLAVA! It is life changing...

Might be my FAVORITE new place in Phoenix! Another fabulous find in our first week in our new hometown.  Still awaiting our storage unit- eating out had become a chore until we found Saba's Mediterranean Kitchen.  After learning that we were new to the area, the owner asked a few questions about our local experiences.  We mentioned that we had liked a local competitor's fare.  He smiled, and never made a negative comment saying,"I'm sure you will love our food, too."  We ordered the chipotle gyro platter, falafel gyro platter, and Chicago gyro platter.  As we paid for our food, we were pleased to find that he included small samples of the lemon rice soup and lentil soup- either one is completely wonderful.  What a great surprise that was!  The food was out of this world and is now our favorite place.
The flaming baklava and saganaki are both amazing!  Great service was quick and waitstaff was very attentive.

We have been going to Saba's since it opened many years ago - 20+.  We watched their kids grow up and now one of them is the owner/manager.  The food is CONSISTENT and outstanding.  They change up their menu often which keeps the selections interesting.  Their homemade buffalo sauce (odd for a Mediterranean kitchen) is second to none.  The spicy feta fries should be patented.  The gyros are outstanding and everything else whether it is gyro, beef, chicken or shrimp is fresh with a homemade touch.  The appetizers are yummy and filling and can be a full meal.  The service never fails to be first-rate and friendly.  We are so fortunate to have Saba's in our neighborhood.

My family just moved to the area recently and wanted a healthy, affordable and flavorful dinner.  We had been eyeing this place for a few weeks bc it's so close and felt it was the perfect day to give it a try.  We were greeted by a friendly staff immediately.  My wife and I both ordered the two item plate.  She got the chicken kabob, chicken shawarma, rice and fries.  I got the lamb shank, steak kabob, grilled vegetables and hummus.  The chicken shawarma was delicious but the star of the show was lamb shank!!! So tender and flavorful, the meat just flaked off the bone and so juicy.  The bone also imparted extra flavor.  The tomato based sauce really complimented the meal well.  The hummus was really fresh and flavorful as well too.  We were treated to some fresh baklava for dessert and the pistachio/nut filling was on point.  The staff of Jared and Cliff were just so attentive and friendly.  Great neighborhood restaurant with fresh ingredients and delicious food, I know my family and I will be coming back soon!

The food and service here are always great. The menu is just the right size and there are options to splurge or eat healthy. Small selection of wine and beer too.  My wife loves the shrimp dishes and the chipotle chicken pita (or gyro meat) is delicious.

I've been coming to this place for over ten years. They are simply the best. Family tradition and quality have sustained the genuine flavor and character of this excellent restaurant. I privately continue to hope they don't get any more popular so that "my favorite little Mediterranean place" retains its original charm, originality and distinction.

First time here the other day, was out running errands and decided to stop in here and give it a try. The place is fairly small and it was packed, we did have to wait a short time for a table, not more than 5 minutes. The hostess was very friendly and welcoming, offered to bring us tea while we waited for our table. I was pleasantly surprised there were many Gluten Free items to choose from. I ordered the Sleepy Gyro Salad and my friend ordered the Chicken Schwarma Pita. We both really enjoyed our lunches. As busy as they were the service did not suffer. And our order came out pretty quickly considering how busy the place was. It didn't let up the entire time we were there either. Our server was nice and attentive. I do want to mention that the small Sleepy Gyro Salad was huge and I had the leftovers for lunch the following day so I would only recommend the larger size if you have an appetite to match. My friend's pita came with fries that I had to taste being a fry fanatic, and they were pretty decent, sprinkled with feta cheese. Mmm cheese. Yeah. I will definitely return.

Not too bad, but not crazy amazing either.  I ordered the Lam Shwarma with baba ganoush.  I wasn't thrilled with the lamb and the baba ganoush was good, but not the best I've ever had.  My family ordered the chicken shwarma and that was pretty tasty.  I'd love to visit this place again when I am in Scottsdale to try out the other menu items.  

The wait staff left something to be desired as we were left without drink refills for some time.

Love this neighborhood restaurant--casual, delicious, family-owned (I believe the second generation is running it now), great friendly staff . . . it's our go-to for gyros, hummus, and pistachio baklava!!

This is our first visit to this restaurant in years. Let's start by mentioning the ambiance, which is sad. The place is long, narrow, and dark. Those requiring handicap seating are literally forced to the back of this bus. The food was good enough; the mint iced tea and grilled vegetables particularly good. The combination platter we ordered was good sized and the price for what we received was very good deal. Special kudos to our server who approached her work with pleasant professionalism. I would certainly agree to returning.
We so enjoyed this restaurant...Lamb Shank...deliciousWe absolutely love sabers restaurant it just doesn't get better than this. It is like a trip to the Mediterranean .

A decent place to get gyros, hummus, etc, plus friendly service. My boyfriend is a fan, so I've been a few times. We usually get the triad of hummus, which is obviously freshly made. They have plain hummus along with pesto, chipotle, and buffalo flavors. Their lemon rice soup is very good - I've never had anything quite like it before. If you've never had it before, I recommend trying a cup. My favorite entree order has been the gyro salad, that way I get more greens and I can make my own little gyros with pita. 

Final verdict is if you're in the neighborhood and in the mood for Greek food, stop by.

Great food for either take out or dine in.  The staff is friendly and engaging.  If you want authentic Mediterranean, this is the place.  We are always bummed when they are closed so we load up when they are open!
Ended up shopping near here by accident and happened upon this place. Excellent food and service.  We will be coming back often.
I love Sabas! It is the best Mediterranean restaurant in Phoenix. The service is always great. The food is fresh and delicious.

First off I want to say coming from Michigan that this is one of the very few places you can find good middle eastern food! My sister and I came in today and we have been searching all of AZ for good lemon rice soup like the way they make it Coney Island but couldn't until today. This place seriously has the best of the best lemon rice soup by far! Everyone there was so nice as well. We were greeted with a hello and seated right away. Everything we ordered was absolutely phenomenal and then we asked for some hot sauce that was seriously so goood! It was different than your regular hot sauce and was more like salsa/chili based but just really good. The owner was very good to us and even through in some baklava which again was by far amazing! Definitely will come back!

We order take out from Saba's, it's one of our favorites. Everyone is so nice and accommodating.
We love to be able to support our local businesses!

Best Mediterranean food I've ever had. I frequent this restaurant even though there is a mediterttanean restaurant near my home. The staff are very friendly and make the dining experience great. I take all my visitors here and they rave about it.

I don't understand why everyone thinks sabas is so good? I got some gross smelling soggy falafel that were clearly made days ago. also, it's a bit dingy and old inside, good ambience and music though, good attempt, work on the food quality a bit.
Service was fantastic. ..Food was wonderful and the owner was personable.   We Had shwarma, Falafel,  gyro.  Great food.  We will definitely be back.

My all time fav place. I go there pretty much every other week with my office buddies. Everything on the menu is amazing. Try George's fav and i can bet you that you will go back again. 
Best Mediterranean restaurant:)

I had previously written a review giving two stars because we had a bad experience at Sabas on a night where they were short staffed due to sick employees.  However, the fact that the owner responded to my review and apologized means a lot and shows how committed they are to providing great service and using feedback to make changes. We will absolutely be back.
This is really good. I've only gotten their gyro and fries, but my husband has ordered different things and always likes what he gets too.

One of my favorite places to get Mediterranean food. I love their chicken kabob plate, love their hummus, and my son raves about their lamb shank. I always have to stop for a bite when I'm in the neighborhood.

Great selection of vegetarian pitas!  I prefer the falafel pita, however the other choices are excellent as well.  Saba's also has a great sides like hummus and pita or their delicious Greek Fries.  I've been a regular at Saba's for a few years now and their service and food is exemplary!  I would defiantly recommend this place to anyone craving some Mediterranean food!

A little disappointed tonight :( I have been here a handful of times & it's usually pretty good not the best nor the worst I have had but reasonably priced & clean atmosphere. Tonight my fries were cold & not cooked all the way through bummer :( the gyro was piping hot & fresh first bite was great but then it was so hot it all fell apart so I then had to eat with a fork I always get my ordered to go. Overall I would say three stars is good for this place.

This was our first time here but it won't be our last. Jared, our server was friendly and efficient. The atmosphere is nice, the copper ceiling tiles were beautiful and the pictures of family made it a welcoming place. I had a bowl of lentil soup that was delicious- a slight tomato taste- different but delicious. My husband and I shared the chicken gyro and it was great as well. Large pieces of juicy chicken, great sauces and flavors. Even the French fries were above average. Prices are reasonable and the quality is excellent. Jared even sent us home with some baklava- can't wait to try it. Lots of vegetarian items, good wine selection. Thoroughly enjoyable.

Service was great here, the gentleman who served us was friendly and our food was served quickly. I was expecting a fast food place, but it is actually a sit down restaurant, small and comfortable. I ordered the chicken kebab plate and my husband had a gyro with an additional side of gyro meat. I also had a cup of the lemon and rice soup. The soup was good and creamy, not  like I've had it in other places. It was also warm, almost lukewarm, not hot at all. I wasn't sure if they served it at this temperature purposely or if they just didn't heat it up enough. I think it may have come from a crock pot that I could see from where I was sitting. The tabouli was good but not as lemony as I like. The chicken kebabs were pretty good. My husband really enjoyed his gyro, and the gyro meat, which I had a bite of, was very good! I would not say this is the best Mediterranean food I have had, but all in all, this place had good service and good food, just a matter of personal preference, I guess.

Saba's has been my local Greek place for over 10 yrs, and it just keeps improving. It was never bad ,so this makes this place amazing. Everyone near Bell n Tatum knows how good it is because Saba's is busy on a Thursday not just the weekend. Great homemade hummus with fresh soft pita bread, terrific gyros sandwich and various great salad.  My friend from Penang loves the lamb shank! The place started by a great couple is now run by the next generation who continue the great food and great service at a great price! Lovr Saba's!
Always a great experience when we come here, whether we do take out, or eat in. Casual, laid back atmosphere for eating in, but great, prompt service. We love splitting a sleepy jyro salad!!!

A great lunch stop. I always get the Grilled Chicken Pita and a cup of soup. The Red Lentil soup is so fabulous that I taught myself how to make a similar version. I also love their Lemon Soup. Great family owns this. It hops at lunch. Healthy and satisfying.

We just moved to the area and we were looking for a yummy Mediterranean restaurant! We had the chicken scwharma, gyro, with Hummus and Greek fries. So glad we tried this place. Everything we got was amazing!! Cannot wait to go back to try more items. I will definitely be back :)

This place kicks butt. Small little dining area. Very private and friendly. I only order the Gyro, they are just too good. I can't NOT order the gyro. These are so good my 4 year old eats them, with tzatziki and everything. So that says a lot because kids rarely know good food...
This is my favorite place!!! Yummy, yummy, clean, courteous and delicious! Been coming here for years and it just keeps getting better! Can I give it 6 stars?

Noticed the Big WORLD'S FAMOUS GYRO sign out front. walked in, very nice and friendly staff. awesome service. Unfortunately the gyro I got was really soggy, the meat and sauce was everywhere, not fresh, and the bread had a very distinct burnt taste to it. The fries were gross... I don't know what went wrong with this place, but it was packed out with people eating awesome looking salads.... I guess I ordered the wrong thing

We had a fabulous lunch here. My wife ordered the gyro salad with the meat charred and it was huge with a delicious dressing. We split it along with the combo  pesto hummus and babaghanouj dip. These were fresh made and were the most delicious we have ever had. The waiter was very friendly and eager to please with a smile. Only thing a little below par was the pita bread. Maybe too long under the heat lamp.

I'm still not sure if it was the service, food, or overall experience that impressed me most in my visit to Saba's. 

The service was absolutely amazing. We went here with a party of 6 and no reservation, and they offered to move a reserved table to another location to give us a booth. From offering samples of the daily soup, bringing an extra order of fries when received a side instead of a shared basket, to bringing us extra baklava for the table while not even charging us for the order of baklava for the birthday girl. 

The food was flavorful and diverse with lots of options for all kinds of preferences. The chicken shawarma was delicious and fresh. The spicy fries were so good! Loved the presentation of the flaming cheese and flaming baklava. DEFINITELY order the flaming baklava: the sugars caramelize and make a favorite treat even better. 

The overall experience left me wanting to go back soon and bring people with me. There are a lot of options for Mediterranean food in the valley, but everything else that makes Saba's unique will keep me coming back.
Great food at reasonable prices. Fabulous baba ganoush! Cute place with friendly service.

From the outside it looks kind of small, but inside there are many booths and tables. 
But this place is awesome!! Carl was our server and he was great too!! He helped us with the menu and helped us decide on our meals.  I settled on lamb pita w/ spicy feta fries and thee wife had a gyro salad. Delicious!! We will definitely be back whenever we visit the Mayo Clinic or the area. Thanks Carl!!

We highly recommend this place for lunch.  Grab a bite to eat and sit outside on their porch; their Mint Iced Tea is really refreshing on a hot day.  We ordered two Chicago Gyros and shared their Spicy Feta Fries.  The Fries are just mildly spicy, but we thought adding Buffalo Sauce (Commonly seen on Hot Wings) was a great idea that we'll steal and use at home.  The combination with Feta really hit the spot.  They serve a good and fresh tasting Gyro.  We can't speak for it's authenticity, but our meal was tasty.  Overall, we enjoyed the food, ambiance, and the friendly employees; we'll be back.

I devoured the World Famous Gyro Pita! So good! Also very affordable. I ordered take out and there were a lot of people in the restaurant and picking up food; I can understand why. I will be frequenting this place from now on.
Most friendly service to go with the great food. Don't forget to get the date dessert.

We tried to eat at sabas tonight but never got service. We had to get our own menus because the guy in the red hat and tattoos couldn't find his way to our table. When he did come and we ordered water he couldn't follow through and bring our water . We had to just leave. We used to really like this place what a terrible experience.
Mmmmm, gyro.  The soup is great too.  Great food, great cost.
Very good food, although a little pricey.  Ordered a take out.  Very nice and polite on the phone.  Food ready quick.  Will definitely be going back.

The red lentil soup is out of this world.  I unfortunately live in the East Valley and only go here when my job brings me to this area.  This is my favorite Mediterranean restaurant in the Phoenix Area.  The food is fresh and flavorful.  The restaurant itself is small but the quality of the food more than makes up for that.  Try the Tzatziki and Hummus they are so good.
I love the gyros here. They pile on the meat. Great service as well...not going to lie, don't get the baklava it was not good. I have had a couple salads as well and they were very tasty!
Always great food and great service! Warm atmosphere and hospitality. I'll be back. Gyros was filling and Jerusalem salad was delicious and enough to take home.

Have visiting this place multiple times since 2010, and it never disappoints me, I have tried chicken shawarma in many places but nothing even comes close to this place.  Best experience was when I went with my parents and i wanted them to taste the best chicken shawarma and they too loved and when the sever came to know it was my parents last day in Phoenix, they gave us a complementary home made Baklava. That made my parents dinner memorable. Thank you!
